Throughout the late '80s and early '90s Epstein was close personal friends with Les Wexner, the billionaire businessman who is the founder and chairman of L Brands. That group of businesses include The Limited, Victoria's Secret, Abercrombie and Fitch, Express, and Bath & Body Works. The pair were so close many referred to Epstein as "the boyfriend" behind their backs. Epstein denied ever having a sexual relationship with the billionaire. But he did use his close connections with Mr Wexner to exploit women. On at least one occasion Epstein posed as a talent scout for Victoria's Secret to lure ...

The appointment comes less than a year after Will Smith joined PetSmart as senior vice president and chief marketing officer. Prior to joining PetSmart, which is headquartered in Phoenix, Ariz., he served as chief marketing officer of Abercrombie & Fitch. Last year, PetSmart chose Cincinnati-based Empower to handle traditional media planning and buying in the U.S. The company spent nearly $241 million on media last year in the U.S., according to Kantar Media, which doesn't track spending on social channels. Leslie Wexner: Where is Jeffrey Epstein's business partner Leslie Wexner now? ...  the accumulation of his riches including Leslie Wexner. Wexner and Epstein are thought to have met around 1986, according to the documentary. Wexner was a self-made man from Ohio, who started out in business in 1963 by opening the women's fashion shop The Limited and went on to purchase other brands. Among the businesses in his portfolio were Abercrombie & Fitch and Victoria's Secret, which led him to become a multi-billionaire. READ MORE: Jeffrey Epstein island: Where is Little Saint James? How did Jeffrey Epstein make his money? ...  scheme was a huge success, and Hoffenberg and Epstein made millions of the back of it with Hoffenberg later being convicted of fraud and sentenced to 20 years in prison. Another phase of Epstein's career which saw him accrue his wealth was the alliance he formed with Les Wexner, chief of L Brands (which owns, among others, Victoria's Secret and Abercrombie and Fitch). Epstein was given power of attorney over Wexner's financial affairs, although their partnership did not stay rosy, with Wexner accusing Epstein of misappropriating in excess of $46 million of his funds and cutting ties with the financier in 2007.
